missions.name: Citadel: Captain Bailey
missions.description: Upon entering the Citadel for the first time, you are flagged by security, because Commander Shepard is deceased. You will need to clear this up with Captain Bailey. This assignment is optional: you will have full access to the Citadel, even while officially listed as dead.
sideEffects: When discussing the option to fix your records or stay dead, Bailey will mention being declared dead for a year as a popular tax dodge - this is from H2G2's Restaurant at the End of the Universe, where the deceased [Hotblack Desiato|http://hitchhikers.wikia.com/wiki/Disaster_Area] is enjoying the show.

missions.name: Citadel: The Council
missions.description:
Anderson wants Shepard to meet with the Council and update them on the Reapers. In Game 2, you are normally restricted to the Zakera Ward levels of the Citadel, but for this assignment you can take a cab to the Ambassador's Office on the Presidium. 

If Shepard saved the Destiny Ascension in Game 1, they will meet with you, but dismiss any news of the Reapers. If the Destiny Ascension was destroyed, the Council will not meet with you at all. If the Ascension was saved *or* if Anderson was seated on the Council instead of Udina, you can be additionally reinstated as a Spectre if you want (but there are no consequences to your choice).

missions.name: Citadel: Crime in Progress
missions.description: The volus [megametracker://person?id=O2.KorTun] has accused a young quarian, [megametracker://perosn?id=O2.LiaVael] of stealing his credit chit, and is complaining to a human C-Sec officer. Find his credit chit to help the quarian out of the situation.

options.trigger: Pull Spectre rank on the officer

missions.name: Citadel: False Positives
missions.description:
Asari Kalara Tomi is unable to leave the Citadel, after being flagged as a potential threat for geth infiltration. She needs help clearing up the mistake. 

This assignment is acquired either during Garrus' loyalty mission, by picking up a forged id before two large mechs, or by talking to two asari found sitting near the stairs down from Level 27, after completing Thane's loyalty mission. 

_Note: You may be able to complete this mission twice, if you do Thane's mission first and help the asari, and then finish Garrus' mission and return to give the (reappeared) asari the fake id._

set.context: Talking to the C-Sec Customs agent
Talking to Kalara Tomi after speaking to the Customs agent

missions.name: Citadel: Krogan Sushi
missions.description: Krogan Kargesh and Rukar and arguing over whether there are any fish in the Presidium lakes. You can resolve their argument by speaking to the [megametracker://person?id=O2.Groundskeeper], a turian at the Dark Star Lounge.

set.context: Resolving Kargesh and Rukar's argument

sideEffects: In Game 1, Wrex may comment on the Presidium "I could use a snack. Think there's any fish out in that lake?"

missions.name: Illium: Blue Rose of Illium
missions.description:
The asari merchant [megametracker://person?id=O2.Ereba] and her krogan boyfriend [megametracker://person?id=O2.Charr] are having problems in their relationship. You might be able to help them decide what to do.

Resolving Ereba's problems with Charm or Intimidate results in a discount at the Memories of Illium store.
missions.x-comment-z: TODO: mission 3 link to charr's death message
sideEffects: If Shepard convinces Ereba and Charr to stay together, they later can be seen on Tuchanka.

set.context: Talking to Ereba

options.trigger: "You should make a decision." and "You should take him back."
"You should make a decision." and "Get rid of him."

missions.name: Illium: Gianna Parasini
missions.description:
*Only available for Game 1 imports, if Gianna Parasini was not killed.* 

[megametracker://person?id=O1.Gianna] meets Shepard for a drink o Illium (as promised in Game 1). She excuses herself early, but leaves a note for Shepard explaining that she is investigating the asari merchant Hermia for smuggling and would appreciate your help in implicating her.

If you haven't already negotiated a discount from [megametracker://person?id=O2.Hermia], you can do so here for Paragon/Renegade, or you can expose Gianna for a discount and Renegade.

set.context: Talking to Gianna Parasini
Negotiating a discount from Hermia at Serrice Technologies
Reporting back to Gianna after entrapping Hermia

missions.name: Talk to Hermia
missions.description: Entrap Hermia by persuading her to sell you technology which she doesn't have the licence to sell. Also, you can convince her to give you a store discount ([megametracker://mission?id=A2.Convo.SerriceTechnology]).

missions.name: Illium: Indentured Service
missions.description:
*If [megametracker://person?id=P1.Conrad] is alive in Game 2, this assignment is not available until completing [megametracker://mission?id=A2.I.ATroublemaker] (and a mission after that).*

A quarian slave wishes to be indentured to Synthetic Insights, but due to negative attitudes to indentured service, Synthetic Insights is unwilling to take on the quarian's contract.

set.context: Talking to the slave broker
Talking to the Synthetic Insights Rep
Informing the slave broker of a successful conversation
Informing the slave broker of an unsuccessful conversation

missions.name: Talk to the Synthetic Insights Rep
missions.description: Persuade the Synthetic Insights rep to purchase the quarian's contract, or not.

missions.name: Report to Slave Broker
missions.description: Return to the slave broker with a Synthetic Insights contract, or convince her to release the quarian anyway.

missions.name: Illium: A Troublemaker
missions.description:
*Only available if Conrad Verner was helped in Game 1.*

An Asari outside the Eternity bar on Illium notifies you of a human making trouble inside.

conversationRewards.context: Talking to the asari outside the Eternity bar

set.context: Talking to Conrad inside the Eternity bar

options.trigger: "What were you doing here?" and "Let me handle this."

set.context: Talking to the merchant at Gateway Personal Defense

options.trigger: "Leave. Now." and "Don't lie to me!" or "I should kill you."

set.context: (Paragon Resolution) Explaining to Conrad after the merchant is arrested
(Renegade Resolution) Talking to Conrad after the merchant tells him the case is closed
(Neutral Resolution) Talking to Conrad after the merchant disappears

missions.name: Talk to Conrad
missions.description: Talk to Conrad Verner at the bar. He explains that the dealer at Gateway Personal Defense told him the bartender was selling Red Sand. The bartender insists she is not, and points out that Red Sand is legal on Illium anyway.

missions.name: Confront the GPD Merchant
missions.description: If you confront the merchant at Gateway Personal Defense, she will admit that she was trying to obtain the deed to the Eternity bar, a valuable piece of real estate.

missions.name: Paragon Resolution (Optional)
missions.description: Entrap the merchant into trying to get the Eternity bar deed herself. She will be caught and arrested, leaving several options for explaining this turn of events to Conrad.

missions.name: Renegade Resolution (Optional)
missions.description: Convince the merchant to lie to Conrad, telling him that the case was resolved and he helped bring down a Red Sand crime ring.

missions.name: Neutral Resolution (Optional)
missions.description: Convince the merchant to disappear.

missions.name: Illium: Medical Scans
missions.description:
A colonist from Zhu's Hope will approach you for help (a green Shiala, if she survived Game 1).

While negotiating for necessary medical treatments from Baria Frontiers, the colonists unknowningly signed up for invasive tests. They need your help to convince the Baria Frontiers representative to let them renegotiate the contract.

conversationRewards.context: Talking to Shiala (if she survived Game 1)

set.context: Talking to Erinya
Telling Shiala about the renegotiated contract (if she survived Game 1)

missions.name: Talk to Erinya
missions.description: Erinya, the Baria Frontiers representative, has a very negative opinion of non-Asari peoples. If you talk to her, maybe you can change her mind.

missions.name: Illium: Lost Locket Found
missions.description: At the end of [megametracker://mission?id=A2.L.Miranda] is a locket. Return it to its owner for a reward.

set.context: Returning the locket

missions.name: Illium: Salarian Family Data
missions.description: You recover a datapad during [megametracker://mission?id=A2.D.Thane]. Return it to its owner.

set.context: Speaking to the Salarian

missions.name: Illium: Smuggling Evidence
missions.description:
There is evidence that Pitne For has been smuggling, found at the Spaceport during [megametracker://mission?id=A2.D.Samara]. You can blackmail Pitne For (Renegade) or alert Detective Anaya (Paragon).

_Note: You cannot return to complete this mission after leaving the spaceport._

missions.name: Renegade Resolution (Optional)
missions.description: Return the evidence to Pitne For.

missions.name: Paragon Resolution (Optional)
missions.description: Return the evidence to Detective Anaya.

missions.name: Illium: Stolen Goods Found
missions.description: There is an unsent note regarding some "lost" goods, found at the Spaceport during [megametracker://mission?id=A2.D.Samara]. Forward the note to the goods' rightful owner.

set.context: Answering Thax when he asks if you sent the note

sideEffects: The asari responsible for the note can be found by the cabs on Illium. If Shepard forwards the note, she will panic and notify her accompice. If Shepard doesn't forward the note, she gloats about her success.

missions.name: Shipping Note
missions.description: Forward the note to the owner of the missing goods (or don't).

missions.name: Illium: System Hacking
missions.description:
Go speak to Liara in the Administration Office. She will indicate she needs help hacking the systems in Illium to acquire some valuable information. 

Hack each of the three terminals below and within 60 seconds of each hack, locate the corresponding server and upload the data to Liara. 

*_Complete this mission before [megametracker://mission?id=DLC2.LairShadowBroker], or it will be marked as complete automatically, and you will gain no experience or reward._*

set.context: Speaking to Liara at the end of the assignment

missions.name: Illium: The Observer
missions.description:
Liara explains that she is hunting a senior agent of the Shadow Broker, known only as *The Observer*. She suspects a turian, a salarian, a krogan, a batarian and a vorcha. 

Liara needs you to hack 5 data terminals and uncover data fragments that will help identify which one is the agent. 

*_Complete this mission before [megametracker://mission?id=DLC2.LairShadowBroker], or it will be marked as complete automatically, and you will gain no experience or reward._*

conversationRewards.context: Talking to Liara about her hunt for the Shadow Broker

set.context: After finding the data fragments

options.trigger: "None of the suspects fit." (ends the assignment)

set.context: Speaking to Liara at the end of the assignment

missions.name: Fragment 1
missions.description: "...trader tried to kill the batarian. Claims it was because he hates slavers, but the men were more likely fighting over money. Watch for now."

missions.name: Fragment 2
missions.description: "Smuggler and assassin have refused to work with the vorcha due to lack of trust. Odd to see scruples from the men at this point."

missions.name: Fragment 3
missions.description: "The turian's asking too many questions. Observer recommends terminating him and framing assassin or salarian contact."

missions.name: Fragment 4
missions.description: "Turian contact working well with the trader. Observer has rescinded kill order against him, given difficulty in securing contact with the trader through other methods."

missions.name: Fragment 5
missions.description: "Vorcha trader has requested no further contact with the salarian. Salarian is becoming more trouble than he is worth. Observer recommends a kill, but she may have a grudge."

missions.name: Omega: Batarian Bartender
missions.description:
A batarian bartender is poisoning humans and has made a personal attack. 

This assignment is acquired by ordering a drink at the lower Afterlife club from the batarian Forvan, and thereby being poisoned. On the upside, after finishing this assignment, you get free drinks at the club for the rest of the game!

set.context: After regaining consciousness after being poisoned at the lower Afterlife bar
After confronting the bartender, Forvan

missions.name: Omega: Datapad Recovered
missions.description: A datapad has been discovered while attempting to recruit Archangel. It contains information which Aria T'Loak, ruler of Omega, will want to see.

set.context: After completing both [megametracker://mission?id=A2.O.ThePatriarch] and [megametracker://mission?id=A2.O.DatapadRecovered]

missions.name: Omega: Missing Assistant
missions.description: Mordin's assistant, Daniel, has gone missing in vorcha territory. Mordin would be grateful if you would find and bring him back.

set.context: Calming down the batarians
Conversation-ending dialog

missions.name: Omega: Packages for Ish
missions.description: A salarian businessman named Ish needs packages picked up. The packages are near Marab's shop on the Citadel and in Eternity on Illium. You can turn them in to Ish, or to Anto.
sideEffects: If Miranda or Jacob are present there will be additional dialog options (they have both had prior dealings with Ish).

set.context: Give Ish the packages

options.trigger: "Aria will find out what you're up to, Ish. I don't envy you when that happens." (+3375 Credits) _(bug: mission will never complete)_

set.context: Give Anto the packages

options.trigger: "This is bad for Aria." or "Aria wouldn't be happy." and "Just be careful."
"This is bad for Aria." or "Aria wouldn't be happy." and "Take care of Ish."
"This is bad for Aria." or "Aria wouldn't be happy." and "Pay me for my silence." (+2250 Credits)

missions.name: Omega: The Patriarch
missions.description: Grizz has a job for you. Aria's old adviser, the Patriarch, is in danger from thugs trying to make a name for themselves. Aria wants the Patriarch moved someplace safe until the threat is gone.

set.context: Talking to the Patriarch

options.trigger: "You have to get out of here."

options.context: Convince the Patriarch to go into hiding
Convince the Patriarch to go into hiding, after charming him into letting you fight on his behalf

set.context: Talking to the Patriarch after fighting the Blue Suns.

conversationRewards.context: Talking to Aria after the Patriarch dies

missions.name: Talk to The Patriarch
missions.description: You can find the Patriarch in the lower level of Afterlife. There are three resolutions available. The Paragon option is convincing the Patriarch to let your squad fight on his behalf. The Renegade option is to mock the Patriarch, convincing him to rush off into battle and die. The neutral option is to convince the Patriarch to go into hiding until things cool off.

missions.name: Paragon Resolution (Optional)
missions.description:
Convince the Patriarch to let your squad fight on his behalf as _krantt_ (this is easier if Grunt is with you, otherwise you will need Paragon points). When you leave Afterlife, two Blood Pack mercenaries will threaten you. You can leave or fight them (cutscene, not real fighting), but either way this concludes the assignment. 

If you speak to the Patriarch afterwards, he will give you some advice about Aria and Omega.

missions.name: Renegade Resolution (Optional)
missions.description: Goad the Patriarch into fighting the Blood Pack himself, and dying. Aria will not be happy that he is dead, but is glad that he died with glory.

missions.name: Neutral Resolution (Optional)
missions.description: This is what Aria wants, but it has no morality points.

missions.name: Report to Grizz
missions.description: If you picked the neutral route, Grizz will thank you and that's it. If you picked the Paragon or Renegade, he will ask you to talk to Aria as well. Then, if you selected the Paragon route, and have completed [megametracker://mission?id=A2.O.DatapadRecovered], Aria will reward you with the location a cache on an uncharted world ([megametracker://mission?id=A2.N7.EclipseSmugglingDepot]).

missions.name: Omega: Struggling Quarian
missions.description: A quarian named Kenn is trying to raise enough money to leave Omega, but is being undercut by Harrot, a powerful merchant.

set.context: Talking to Harrot about the quarian

conversationRewards.context: Offer to pay his way (unavailable after Harrot buys his shop)

missions.name: Speak to Kenn
missions.description: Kenn at Kenn's Salvage is struggling to save enough money to leave Omega, but Harrot's Emporium keeps undercutting his prices and he can't make a profit. You can resolve this with Harrot at no expense, or you can buy Kenn's ticket off Omega for him.

missions.name: Speak to Harrot (Optional)
missions.description: Convince Harrot to leave Kenn alone (requires Paragon) or just buy Kenn out (requires Renegade). This also rewards a discount on both stores for the rest of the game.

missions.name: Inform Kenn (Optional)
missions.description:
If you opted for the Paragon resolution with Harrot, you can check in with Kenn before he leaves Omega. You can also offer to pay his way home. 

If you selected the Renegade option, Kenn will already be gone.

missions.name: N7: Abandoned Mine
missions.description:
_"Surface scans report potential alien signatures from within the mining facility. Anomalous life signs detected. Whereabouts of the facility staff unknown."_

 Note: retrieve any loot before destroying the Reaper device.

missions.name: N7: Abandoned Research Station
missions.description:
_"Data mining confirms the last reported location of merchant freighter MSV Corsica as the Jarrahe Station in the Strabo system. Possibility exists that clues pertaining to the anomaly that caused the mass malfunction of the mechs aboard Corsica can be found aboard Jarrahe Station."_

 This is the last stop of the MSV Corsica before its VI was compromised and it crashed into the planet. It is quickly apparent that the VI here has also gone rogue and will need to be shut down.

missions.name: Restore Power to Docking Area
missions.description: As soon as you turn power back on, the VI will lock you in and you must use the console to unlock the doors. Select the left-most computer, then the right-most computer.

missions.name: Restore Power to Living Quarters
missions.description: As soon as you turn power back on, the VI will lock you in and you must use the console to unlock the doors. Select the left-most computer, then the right-most computer.

missions.name: Restore Power to Research Lab
missions.description: As soon as you turn power back on, the VI will lock you in and you must explode the tank on the far side of the lab to unlock the doors. Bounce the laser beam to the tank by triggering the first computer once, the second twice, the third once, and the fourth three times.

missions.name: Restore Power to Engineering
missions.description: Avoid the venting plasma jets and turn the power back on. You won't be locked in this time.

missions.name: Restore Power to the VI
missions.description: Turn the power on at the central hub and disable the VI before it uploads to the Normandy.

missions.name: Shut Down VI
missions.description: Shut down the VI Mainframe.

missions.name: N7: Anomalous Weather Detected
missions.description:
_"Sensors detecting anomolous weather patterns on the planet's surface. Geth activity detected. Recommend extreme caution."_ 

Locate and shut down the geth device causing the extreme weather changes.

missions.name: N7: Archeological Dig Site
missions.description:
_"Mercenary activity detected on planet surface. Communications match Blue Suns encoding protocols. Possible location for rumored site of illegal archeological activity. Blue Suns intentions unknown."_ 

ExoGeni uncovered a prothean artifact and contracted with the Blue Suns to transport it. The Blue Suns decided they could sell it for more elsewhere. Fight your way through several waves of Blue Suns troops to the dig site and the prothean pyramid.

missions.name: N7: Blood Pack Communications Relay
missions.description:
_"Preliminary scans indicate a high-powered communications relay on the planet. Communications match known Blood Pack mercenary protocols. A concentration of krogan and vorcha signals are massed inside what appears to be a mining operation. Life signs detected. Unknown species. Advise caution."_ 

Fight through the Blood Pack and klixen (similar to rachni) to shut down the communications relay on the hill. If you have the Shrike Abyssal charts from [megametracker://mission?id=A2.UC.StarCharts], it is not important which Blood Pack mission you complete first. Otherwise you will need to complete this one first.

missions.name: N7: Blood Pack Base
missions.description:
_"Scans show a crude base established on the planet's surface. Communications match known Blood Pack mercenary protocols. Numerous life signs matching vorcha genealogy detected. The base's material resources match our data on weapons manufacturing components."_ 

 Fight through the Blood Pack forces to the facility and detonate the four containment cells inside. If you have the Shrike Abyssal charts from [megametracker://mission?id=A2.UC.StarCharts], it is not important which Blood Pack mission you complete first. Otherwise you will need to complete the communications relay first.

missions.name: N7: Blue Suns Base
missions.description:
_"Distress beacon detected on initial sweep is confirmed to be a fabrication set in place to lure unsuspecting ships into orbit for pirate ambush. Preliminary scans indicate that shutting down false distress beacon will stop the Blue Suns transmission and disable their ambush site. Surface scans show Blue Suns communication signatures concentrated around a shuttle hangar bay."_ 

You will need to enter the mining facility and fight through multiple waves of Blue Suns, two YMIR Mechs at once, and a boss, in order to destroy the transmitter.

missions.name: N7: Captured Mining Facility
missions.description:
_"Mercenary activity detected inside a mining facility on the planet's surface. Facility confirmed registered to Eldfell-Ashland Energy Corporation. Eclipse presence confirmed. Distress beacon powered down at site. Sensors detect multiple space faring vessel launches from facility."_ 

Enter the facility and fight through the Eclipse mercenaries to the central computer. Start decrypting the data there and fight off more mercenaries until it finishes.

missions.name: N7: Eclipse Smuggling Depot
missions.description:
_"The planet Daratar in the Faryar system is a suspected Eclipse smuggling site. Cerberus is interested in obtaining the materials kept at this site. Operatives will be paid handsomely for any intact crates retrieved from the site. Be aware that Eclipse would rather see the cargo destroyed than lose it to a rival organization. Payment will be made once the acquisition of undamaged crates is verified."_ 

This mission is normally acquired from Aria after bringing her the datapad from Archangel's base and dealing with Patriarch, but you can also just go to the planet and scan it. 

*THIS IS A TIMED MISSION!* You need to kill three YMIR Mechs before they destroy the 20 crates. You get more credits the more crates you save.

missions.name: N7: Endangered Research Station
missions.description:
_"Planetary scans indicate that the Sinmara colony is vulnerable to its sun's hazardous solar flares. Malfunction detected in colony's magnetic shield. Shield must be reactivated to avoid exposing colony to unstable solar activity and potential annihilation."_ 

 There is no battle here, just a puzzle. Bypass the central terminal, then continue on and activate the control switch twice then power up the cooling unit on the left, activate the control switch twice then power up the shield generator, activate the control switch twice then power up the shield control and bypass it.

missions.name: N7: Hahne-Kedar Facility
missions.description:
"Surface scan detects mech production facility matching the registration parameters of Hahne-Kedar Corporation. Facility reports emergency lockdown at this location. Personnel scans report no living beings detected. Hazard scans show a large number of virus-infected mechs quarantined within the facility. Deactivation of the primary production line controls should disrupt the creation of additional infected mechs."

You will have to take out two FERNRIS Mechs and two LOKI Mechs just to get inside the facility. Then you will be fighting a sea of various rogue mechs as you make your way down to the production floor. There you can shut down operations from the control center terminal.

missions.name: N7: Imminent Ship Crash
missions.description:
_"Scans detect a rapidly decaying derelict ship in orbit over planet Jonus. Registration matches the MSV Broken Arrow. Ship's manifest notes volatile munitions cargo onboard. If left undisturbed, the ship's trajectory will lead to impact with Jonus. High probability that the crash site will be Fargone, Jonus' largest human colony. Geth signatures detected aboard the MSV Broken Arrow."_ 

*THIS IS A TIMED MISSION!* There will be a few geth to take down as you go through the ship, but the waves of them start when you reach the engine room. In between waves, activate the two power couplings on each side of the room. When complete, restore power to the engine in the center. 

You will need the Pylos Nebula charts from [megametracker://mission?id=A2.UC.StarCharts] before you can complete this assignment.

missions.name: N7: Javelin Missiles Launched
missions.description:
_"Scans detect an Alliance colony defended by a Javelin Mk. II missile base. A distress signal indicates that the base is compromised by batarians who have launched two missiles at the Alliance colony. Total destruction of the colony is imminent. Zero probability of survivors if missiles strike. Find the control panel in the Javelin Mk. II missile base. Time of impact calculated: landing party will have 5 minutes to deactivate the missiles after shuttle touchdown."_ 

 This mission is normally acquired after [megametracker://person?id=P2.N7.BlueSunsBase], but you can also just go to the planet and scan it.

*THIS IS A TIMED MISSION!* Fight your way to the silo control room and bypass the terminal. You will have to make a choice to save the spaceport or the residential district.

missions.name: N7: Lost Operative
missions.description:
_"Signal scans detect a transmitter matching Cerberus encryption. It is registered to an unknown deep cover operative. Cerberus operative life signs unconfirmed. Other transmissions that match known Eclipse coded communications also detected."_ 

Once you have eliminated all the Eclipse troops in the main room, bypass the holding cell access and fight the additional troops. You will then be able to bypass the door to the interrogation room. Access the console and choose whether to give the data to Cerberus, the Alliance, or keep it for youself.

There are no future consequences to any of these choices.

missions.name: N7: Mining the Canyon
missions.description:
_"Surface scans detect one YMIR Heavy Mech signature matching an unknown (possibly pirate) registration. Mech appears to be disabled but broadcasting a looping message. Message does not appear to be a distress signal. Resource scans indicate large quantities of mineral resources available but obscured behind walls of dense stone."_ 

This is a typical guide mission, where you must take the YMIR Mech from battery to battery to reach the other end of the canyon. There are two varren you have to fight to get one of the batteries, but that is the only fighting involved.

missions.name: N7: MSV Estevanico
missions.description:
_"Alliance sources request that all ships keep watch for signs of the missing freighter MSV Estevanico, lost one year ago in this sector. Any data recovered that sheds light on the Estevanico's fate will be rewarded. Surface scans indicate the presence of a large shipwreck. Signature bears similarities of the Alliance merchant freighter MSV Estevanico. Structural integrity is critical. Life support is damaged but capable of sustaining a skeleton crew. Recommend extreme caution."_ 

This is a maze where you must navigate your way to the mainframe. As you progress, the ship will shift and pieces will fall, creating new routes. You can't be hurt during the assignment.

missions.name: N7: MSV Strontium Mule
missions.description:
After uncovering the prothean pyramid in [megametracker://mission?id=A2.N7.ArcheologicalDig], Cerberus asks you to track down a ship that carried off valuable intel from the dig site.

 You will have to eliminate all the Blue Suns and FENRIS Mechs, and then the room with the cargo Cerberus wants is unlocked and you can retrieve it.

missions.name: N7: Quarian Crash Site
missions.description:
_"Surface scans show evidence of a shipwreck meeting quarian design specifications. Identity of ship unknown. Number of life signs detected in vicinity uncertain. Local wildlife may interfere with accuracy of biological scan."_ 

Follow the trail of blood to the wounded quarian survivor. Protect her from waves of varren attacks.

missions.name: N7: Wrecked Merchant Freighter
missions.description:
_"Surface scans indicate wreckage of a merchant freighter, configuration unknown. Damage to ship catastrophic. Detecting movement, but no signs of organic life."_ 

After their VI was compromised and cargo of mechs began exploding, the MSV Corsica crashed. Once you have deactivated the distress beacon, you will have to fight off the remaining mechs (180 reported in cargo log), and one YMIR Mech. They will attack in waves as you advance your position back towards the shuttle.

missions.name: Normandy: FBA Couplings
missions.description:
The engineers could use the new T6-FBA couplings to make their maintenance work easier. 

Acquired by speaking to Kenneth Donnelly or Gabriella Daniels in Engineering.

set.context: During first conversation

missions.name: Normandy: Serrice Ice Brandy
missions.description:
Dr. Chakwas tells you she lost a rare bottle of Serrice Ice Brandy when the original Normandy was destroyed. If you can, find her a new bottle. 

Acquired by speaking to Dr. Chakwas in the Medical Bay.

missions.name: Normandy: Special Ingredients
missions.description:
The Normandy's cook would appreciate special ingredients to make better food. Most of the supplies he wants are at the Citadel. 

Acquired by speaking to [megametracker://person?id=P2.Gardner] at the Mess Hall.

missions.name: Tuchanka: Combustion Manifold
missions.description: The mechanic on Tuchanka needs a Combustion Manifold, which you will run across during [megametracker://mission?id=A2.L.Mordin]. You can talk to the mechanic before boarding the vehicle to the Weyrloc Facility to start the assignment, or just turn the manifold in after completing the loyalty mission.

missions.name: Tuchanka: Killing Pyjaks
missions.description:
Ratch invites you to kill some pyjaks - pests on Tuchanka. A minigame is available next to Chief Scout where you can fire dual turrets against three waves of pyjaks. 

_Completing this assignment rewards a discount at the store, as well as makes available Pyjak Meat for purchase._
sideEffects: After completing this mission and buying the Pyjak Meat from Ratch, if you feed the meat to the varren Urz, Urz will become your loyal pet, following you everywhere on Tuchanka.

missions.name: Tuchanka: Missing Scout
missions.description:
Talk to Chief Scout next to the Pyjak firing range. He is looking for missing scout sent into Weyrloc territory. 

When you find the despondent scout in the Weyrloc facility, you can persuade him to leave. If you lie, he will attack you instead, and the assignment will fail. 

_You must speak to Chief Scout before boarding the vehicle for [megametracker://mission>id=A2.L.Mordin], or the missing scout will not be found in the Weyloc Facility_

set.context: Selecting the Paragon above.
"What did they do to you?"
